data.title: ATOM Ernest Rutherford
data.text:
ErnestRutherford

Ernest Rutherford was a Nobel prize winning scientist born 30th August 1871.

"All science is either physics or stamp collecting." - Ernest Rutherford.

Achievements

Discoveries

Summery

Bibliography

Pictures

Video

Nobel Prize

In 1908 Ernest Rutherford won a Nobel prize for Chemistry.Rutherford found out that the atom was made from a nucleus surrounded by electrons.

Return

Nobel Prize

Copley Medal

Rumford Medal

The Copley Medal

The Copley Medal is awarded for outstanding achievements in any type of science.

Ernest Rutherford won his Copley medal in 1922 for his study in radioactivity and the discovery of the nucleus in the atom.

Return

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec vitae ullamcorper ipsum. Praesent ultricies augue ut venenatis

In 1904 he also won the Rumford medal for again an outstanding discovery in any science.

Return

Discoveries

He discovered:

the atomic nucleus, the proton, the alpha particle, and the beta particle.

Summary

Ernest Rutherford was a scientist from New Zealand. He was responsible for a great number of discoveries that were related to radioactivity and nuclear physics. Throughout his life he won many awards like the Nobel Prize for chemistry and the Copley Medal. He also made many discoveries. He discovered alpha and beta rays. And he created the theory that the atom is mostly empty space which Ernest Walton and John Cockroft proved correct.
